duck: treat definition: to discuss terms of accommodation or settlement.
Rice Krispies treat - Rice Krispies Treats are a sweet dessert or snack made from Rice Krispies, melted butter or margarine, and melted marshmallows.
Confectionery - Confectionery is related to the food items that are rich in sugar and often referred to as a confection.
Samuel Treat (1815–1902), U.S. federal judge from Missouri

Chocolate-coated marshmallow treats - Chocolate-coated marshmallow treats are produced in different variations around the world, with several countries claiming to have invented it or hailing it as their "national confection".
John Whittier Treat, Professor of East Asian Languages and Literatures at Yale University
Samuel Hubbel Treat, Jr. (1811–1887), U.S. federal judge from Illinois
Treaty - A treaty is an express agreement under international law entered into by actors in international law, namely sovereign states and international organizations.
Charles H. Treat, U.S. Treasurer under Theodore Roosevelt
Cook's treat, unservable food enjoyed by the preparers

Assassin of Turkish-Armenian journalist 'treated as national hero'
Cutty Sark blaze treated as 'suspicious'
Study will examine treating heart damage with adult stem cells
Tennessee closes down Christian ex-gay camp for treating mental illness without a license
West Australian Premier Geoff Gallop resigns
Israeli PM Ariel Sharon undergoes emergency surgery
Dairy cattle with names produce more milk, according to new study
Man cuts off his own penis in UK restaurant
Two arrests after murder in Bristol, United Kingdom
Surgeon declares that Fidel Castro does not have cancer
Pope to leave hospital

wiki.text:
'Treat', 'Treats', or 'TREAT' can refer to:

;Food and drink:
* Confectionery
* Chicken Treat, Australian fast food chain
* Chocolate-coated marshmallow treats
* Cook's treat, unservable food enjoyed by the preparers
* Rice Krispies treat
* Tahitian Treat, U.S. soft drink

;Law:
* Treating, serving refreshments for electoral gain
* Invitation to treat, inviting an offer

;Given name:
* Treat Baldwin Johnson (1875-1947), U.S. chemist
* Treat Williams (b. 1951) U.S. actor

;Surname:
* Charles H. Treat, U.S. Treasurer under Theodore Roosevelt
* Herb Treat (c.1900-1947), American football player
* John Whittier Treat, Professor of East Asian Languages and Literatures at Yale
  University
* Lawrence Treat (1903-1998), U.S. mystery writer
* Richard Treat (1584–1669), early Connecticut settler
* Robert Treat (1622–1710), governor of Connecticut
* Robert Treat Paine (disambiguation)
* Roger Treat (1906–1969), U.S. writer
* Samuel Treat (1815–1902), U.S. federal judge from Missouri
* Samuel Hubbel Treat, Jr. (1811–1887), U.S. federal judge from Illinois
* Spencer Treat Clark (b. 1987), U.S. actor

;Music:
* The Treat, English progressive rock band
* Treat (band), Swedish band successful in the 1980s

;Other:
* [[Treats]], 1975 play by Christopher Hampton
* Treat, Algeria, town
* Trick-or-treating, Halloween tradition
